alert.note: Alert for West Jackson and West Grand Counties Above 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 20 at 6:48PM MST until December 22 at 6:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: .A strong arctic airmass brings well-below normal temperatures to northeastern Colorado Wednesday evening through Friday. In combination with strong winds, this will bring dangerous wind chill. Snow will accompany the passing system Wednesday evening through early Thursday for the mountains and plains with localized higher amounts for portions of the higher mountains. 6-9 PM Wednesday will feature the best chances for moderate snowfall rates over parts of the plains. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON WEDNESDAY TO 6 AM MST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM WEDNESDAY TO 11 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 4 and 12 inches. Winds gusting as high as 65 mph. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 50 below zero. * WHERE...Rabbit Ears Pass. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from Noon Wednesday to 6 AM MST Thursday. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 8 PM Wednesday to 11 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. Exposed skin may become quickly frostbitten or frozen. Wind chill values may fall to extremely dangerous levels.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org. The combination of wind and cold temperatures will create dangerously low wind chill values. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.

area.areaDesc: West Jackson and West Grand Counties Above 9000 Feet
